TextTrack.summary: The TextTrack interface of the WebVTT API represents a text track associated with a media element.

remarks.para: An object of this type owns the list of objects that will be displayed over the video at various points.

TextTrack objects can be added to a or element using the method, which has the same effect as adding text tracks declaratively using {{htmlelement("track")}} elements inside a {{htmlelement("video")}} or {{htmlelement("audio")}} element.
The TextTrack objects are stored in a , which can be retrieved using the property.

TextTrackActiveCues.summary: The activeCues read-only property of the interface returns a object listing the currently active cues.

TextTrackAddCue.summary: The addCue() method of the interface adds a new cue to the list of cues.

TextTrackCuechange.summary: The cuechange event fires when a has changed the currently displaying cues. The event is fired on both the TextTrack and the in which it's being presented, if any.

TextTrackCues.summary: The cues read-only property of the interface returns a object containing all of the track's cues.

TextTrackId.summary: The id read-only property of the interface returns the ID of the track if it has one.
TextTrackId.value: A string containing the ID, or an empty string.

TextTrackInBandMetadataTrackDispatchType.summary: The inBandMetadataTrackDispatchType read-only property of the interface returns the text track's in-band metadata dispatch type of the text track represented by the object.

remarks.para: An in-band metadata dispatch type is a string extracted from a media resource specifically for in-band metadata tracks. An example of a media resource that might have such tracks is a TV station streaming a broadcast on the web. Text Tracks may be used to include metadata for ad targeting, additional information such as recipe data during a cooking show, or trivia game data during a game show.
The value of this attribute could be used to attach these tracks to dedicated script modules as they are loaded.

TextTrackInBandMetadataTrackDispatchType.value: A string containing the inBandMetadataTrackDispatchType, or an empty string.

TextTrackKind.summary: The kind read-only property of the interface returns the kind of text track this object represents. This decides how the track will be handled by a user agent.

TextTrackLabel.summary: The label read-only property of the interface returns a human-readable label for the text track, if it is available.
TextTrackLabel.value: A string containing the label, or an empty string.

TextTrackLanguage.summary: The language read-only property of the interface returns the language of the text track.

remarks.para: This uses the same values as the HTML lang attribute. These values are documented in {{RFC(5646, "Tags for Identifying Languages (also known as BCP 47)")}}.

TextTrackLanguage.value: A string containing a language identifier. For example, "en-US" for United States English or "pt-BR" for Brazilian Portuguese.

TextTrackMode.summary:
The interface's
mode property is a string specifying and controlling the
text track's mode: disabled, hidden, or
showing. You can read this value to determine the current mode,
and you can change this value to switch modes.

remarks.para:
Safari additionally requires the default
boolean attribute to be set to true when implementing your own video player controls in
order for the subtitles cues to be shown.

TextTrackMode.value: A string which indicates the track's current mode. One of:

TextTrackRemoveCue.summary: The removeCue() method of the interface removes a cue from the list of cues.

TextTrackSourceBuffer.summary:
The read-only sourceBuffer property of the interface returns the
that created the track, or null if the track was not
created by a or the has been
removed from the attribute of its parent
media source.
